bl4ckscor3.engine.jpixel

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • bl4ckscor3.engine.jpixel.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple window with a loop in it

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(int w,
              int h,
              java.lang.String t,
              boolean c,
              boolean r,
              int o,
              boolean m)
        Sets up the window but will NOT start it. Use the setDisplay() and show() methods to let it show up
        Parameters:
        w - The width of inside the window
        h - The height of inside the window
        t - The title of the window
        c - Should the window be opened in the center of the screen?
        r - Should the window be resizable by the user?
        o - The operation to do when the red x is pressed (see JFrame for reference)
        m - Is this the main window (with the game loop)?

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        Sets up the window with the predefined values. You should never call this method twice
        Throws:
        Throws - a NPE when setDisplay() hasn't been called yet.

        public void setDisplay(Display d)
